description In the letter Knox explains that the Creek nation and the United States have just signed the Treaty of New York, a pact of "peace and strict friendship." He is sending this message with Creek representatives who are returning home, and he instructs Burbeck to treat them well: "The interests of the United States and the Creeks henceforward are proposed to be the same. You will therefore receive Brigadier General McGillivray with all the respect due his rank, and you will assist him and the Creeks with him to the utmost of your power in ascending the river St. Marys and transporting their goods and baggage." Though the original letter was sent by Creek leader Alexander McGillivray, this copy was delivered by the "Tallisee King," who was traveling on a different boat.
